docs.snippet: Starting Sunday, Delta will allow free testing on three messaging apps, giving it an advantage with travelers who would otherwise have to pay for Wi-Fi service.

headline.print_headline: Delta Will Offer Free Text Messaging on Its Flights
headline.main: Delta to Offer Free In-Flight Text Messaging

docs.snippet: Military and government officials met in the capital in a bid to restore law and order after deadly clashes between supporters of a firebrand cleric and the police.

headline.print_headline: Pakistan Deploys Military Troops After Clashes in Islamabad Leave 6 Dead
headline.main: Pakistan Deploys Military Troops After Violent Clashes in Islamabad

docs.snippet: New recipes from Melissa Clark and David Tanis, plus a range of lively dishes for the week.
President Trump named his budget director as the agency’s acting leader, moving to take control just hours after its departing leader had taken steps to install his own choice for acting chief.

headline.print_headline: Agency Picked A New Leader; So Did Trump
headline.main: Dueling Appointments Lead to Clash at Consumer Protection Bureau

docs.snippet: A legal battle over who will run the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau broke out after its chief abruptly resigned on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Who Will Be in Charge of Consumer Agency on Monday? It’s Still Unclear
headline.main: Who Will Be Running Consumer Agency on Monday? It’s Unclear

docs.snippet: Seavey, a four-time champion and part of the sport’s most well-known family, had four dogs test positive for a banned opioid pain reliever in this year’s dog-sled race.

headline.main: Dog Doping at the Iditarod: Dallas Seavey, a Legend in the Sport, Is Named

docs.snippet: Thursday: Your options during the L train shutdown, wintry weather and readers reflect on the terrorist attack.

headline.main: New York Today: The Plan for the L Train Shutdown

docs.snippet: Alexandra Rose Howland documented a community of internally displaced Abkhazians who made their home inside an abandoned hospital.

headline.main: After Fleeing War, They Made an Abandoned Hospital Their Home

docs.abstract: Alexandra Rose Howland documented a community of internally displaced Abkhazians who made their home inside an abandoned hospital.

docs.snippet: The Times’s New Old Age columnist explains how she approaches writing about the elderly — and the effects her columns have had.

headline.print_headline: Keeping Up With an Aging America
headline.main: How I Keep the Topic of Aging Fresh

docs.snippet: Joao Silva came of age chronicling South Africa’s transition to democracy. In a new series of images, he looks at how the country’s gap between rich and poor poses new challenges.

headline.main: Photos of South Africa Show a Country Still Divided

docs.abstract: Joao Silva came of age chronicling South Africa’s transition to democracy. In a new series of images, he looks at how the country’s gap between rich and poor poses new challenges.
